com.totsp.gwittir.client.flow
Class FlowContext

java.lang.Object
  com.totsp.gwittir.client.flow.FlowContext

public class FlowContext
extends java.lang.Object

A FlowContext is a registry of BoundWidgets or BoundWidgetProviders and Actions to activity names. Each .add() method returns this, so you can use a builder pattern: FlowContext context = new FlowContext() .add() .add() .add();

Author:
Robert "kebernet" Cooper

public FlowContext add(java.lang.String name,
                       BoundWidget<?> widget)
Adds a BoundWidget to a given activity name

Parameters:
name - The activity name to register
widget - The BoundWidget to use
Returns:
this (builder pattern)

add

public FlowContext add(java.lang.String name,
                       BoundWidgetProvider<?> provider)
Adds a BoundWidgetProvider for a given activity name. This method should be used where the BoundWidget needs to be recreated with each activity call (not a singleton). Optionally you can use a Singleton provider to delay initialization of the BoundWidget until it is needed.

Parameters:
name - The activity name to register
provider - The BoundWidgetProvider to use
Returns:
this (builder pattern)

add

public FlowContext add(java.lang.String name,
                       BoundWidget<?> widget,
                       Action action)
Adds a BoundWidget with an Action mapping

Parameters:
name - The activity name to register
widget - The BoundWidget to use
action - The Action to register with the BoundWidget
Returns:
this (builder pattern)
